message: This command was featured on vim tips twitter acct today :Sex it opend your file tree,, how do you use it from there?? Tips? For some  reason I can remember the command...

The most basic thing you can do is use j and k to move up and down to highlight files and directories. Press enter to enter that directory or open that file. There are many other commands in this window, you can press F1 to get more help on the possible commands.
I say "native", because it is still a plugin, but it comes bundled with the Vim distribution, so everybody has it
The :Sex command brings up the netrw plugin - which is Vim's "native" file explorer
unlike the NerdTree, which is the first plugin that most people install when they try out Vim
Personally, I prefer the native file explorer to the NerdTree
I made a video about it: http://vimcasts.org/episodes/the-file-explorer/
@nelstrom: I don't think NerdTree and netrw are intended for the same purpose. While NerdTree is a file explorer, netrw is primarily for editing files remotely.
Excellent video on netrw nelstrom! I use netrw everyday and rarely for editing remote files. It works just fine with local files.
@jmcantrell The name 'netrw' would seem to suggest that it is primarily for editing files remotely, but I've never used it for that purpose. I think the plugin is badly named.
@nelstrom Many (including myself) would argue that it's a crappy plugin, in general.
